text: Mr Isaac, a 67-year-old male, has attended for repeat prescriptions and asks the GP for a ‘general checkup’. His past medical history includes well controlled hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia, and mild osteoarthritis. He stopped smoking 10 years 2g0 and drinks 6 standard drinks/week. On examination of his abdomen the GP feels a small, central, pulsatile, non-tender mass. Otherwise the abdomen is soft, there is no other tenderness, masses nor organomegaly. What s the most appropriate next step? @ A Arrange an abdominal ultrasound O 8. No further management required O C Organise a CT angiogram O D.Organise an MRI angiography O & Urgently transfer to the hospital
